bioghist.p: Evaline (Michelow) Ness (1911-1986) was a children's book author and illustrator. In addition to her own books, Ness illustrated books for such well-known children's writers as Lloyd Alexander and Stephen Kroll. She was a runner-up for the Caldecott Medal for three straight years before she won it in 1967 for her book Sam, Bangs and Moonshine. In addition to the Caldecott Medal, Ness won ALA Notable Book, Horn Book Honors, and the Hans Christian Anderson Award for books produced from the 1950s to the 1970s. In 1938 Evaline married FBI agent Eliot Ness. They divorced in 1946. She married Arnold Bayard in 1959.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of illustrations by Evaline Ness. The collection includes finished art for her book Old Mother Hubbard and Her Dog. The bulk of the collection, however, consists of her illustrations for books by Lloyd Alexander. Materials include dummies, color separations, preliminary art for book jackets, title page drawings, and maps. The Lloyd Alexander books documented here are Coll and His White Pig, The Truthful Harp, The Book of Three, The Black Cauldron, The Castle of Llyr, The High King, and Taran Wanderer.
